page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: {Transport}is of major importance to the people of Lanark.{Roads }are the main key to the prosperity of Lanark over the centuries and still play an important role today.The A.73. passes through the town from Cumbernauld and Airdrie and links up with the A.74 (the main western road for Scotland) at Abington.As {Communications }have always been important is not surprising that there has been some debate as to wether there should be a ring road or a new road driven throgh the town.{Rail}links have also been important,but due to missed opportunities in the last century Lanark never became a major hub of the rail system. The town used to have a link to Edinburgh and to Ayr;only the link to Glasgow survives.The Glasgow service is very well patronized.
